content.question: Points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> shown above are in the plane of the page and <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meters apart. The points are located in a uniform electric field of magnitude <math alttext="1000 volts per meter " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1000</mn><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mtext>V</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> directed toward the bottom of the page. When a proton (of charge <math alttext="positive e " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ) moves from point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, how much work is done on the proton by the electric field?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
